result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney M Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • DISORDERLY CONDUCT [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rodney M Coleman in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Rodney M Coleman.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 2  - Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Charges DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 3 -  
PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

SENTENCING HEARING HELD: Statements by the State, Defense counsel and Defendant.
COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction  with credit for 5 DAYS time served.  Huber privileges to apply for employment.
Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.
    
* Pay all mandatory costs, fees and  surcharges. Payable in 1 year or Civil Judgment.
* Defendant to provide DNA specimen and pay DNA surcharge.
* Restitution set at ZERO.
* Maintain /Obtain Full time Employment.
* Attend a cognitive thinking/behavioral modification program and successfully complete the program. 
* No new law violations rising to probable cause.
* 20 HOURS of community service. 
* Court will allow expungement upon successful completion of probation sentence. 
* Appellate Rights given.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

OFF THE RECORD. 
Case calendared for a Plea and sentencing on August 26, 2022, however, the court will not be in session due to a judicial conference.
New date confirmed with defense counsel via email. State notified. Plea and Sentencing scheduled August 29, 2022 at 9:30am.

Defendant Rodney M Coleman in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/ Elements of the Offense.
Court finds defendant knowingly and willingly WAIVED her/his right to have an in person hearing and proceeds Remotely.
However, due to technical difficulties Court ordered matter adjourned for an in-person hearing.
Case remains calendared in Branch 19. 

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
AND Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defense request a plea and sentencing hearing. Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 
This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Rodney M Coleman in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to review and discuss with the defendant. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.  
Scheduling conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Rodney M Coleman in court with attorney Edgar A Beltran.  Defendant Rodney M Coleman in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
